other_tests.findings: Follicular cells with enlarged nuclei and condensed chromatin, suggesting malignancy.
Pathological diagnosis was microfollicular adenoma with no invasion of the capsule or blood vessels, namely a benign neoplasm.
Three nodules in the left lobe along with scattered hypoechogenic foci in the thyroid parenchyma.
PAX8 mutation detected in the lymphocytes; level of the mutant allele was significantly lower than that of the wild-type allele, indicating somatic mosaic state.
Dense aggregates of thyrocytes with absent or very small follicles, resembling a fetal thyroid in the late phase of development.
